title.narrative: To provide an effective response and meet the immediate humanitarian needs of Health, Water Sanitation and Health (WASH), Shelter and Protection following Hurricane Matthew in the Caribbean

description.narrative: This activity (To provide an effective response and meet the immediate humanitarian needs of Health, Water Sanitation and Health (WASH), Shelter and Protection following Hurricane Matthew in the Caribbean) is a component of Humanitarian Response to Hurricane Matthew in the Caribbean reported by FCDO, with a funding type of 'Not for profit organisation' and a budget of £7,999,998. This component benefits Developing countries, unspecified, and works in the following sector(s): Material relief assistance and services . , with the following implementing partners: ActionAid UK, British Red Cross, CANADEM, CARE International UK, Crown Agents Limited, Danish Refugee Council, Internews Europe, MapAction, Mission Aviation Fellowship UK, Norwegian Refugee Council, United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF). The start date is 06-10-2016 and the end date is 31-03-2017.

owner-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

mailing-address.narrative: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - Social Affairs - Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - emergency relief
